page.title: 08LEWES TO BRIGHTON RAILWAY
page.content: The {Lewes }to {Brighton} Railway runs parallel to the road and was built in 1846. This first type of railway carried carts and coaches just like those used on the road, but now Diesel Class Seventy Three run on this line powered by a live electric rail. {The first }work was carried out by {Navvies},but now {Trackmen} do it, who wear reflective {clothing }to safeguard them. An accident happened at {Lewes Station }where the boilers blew up in 1879 and the Driver, Rookwood, was killed and his fireman and a few others were hurt .Later in 1932, a child placed a sleeper on the line which caused a de-railment, killing several people. By STUART T ROBBIE B STEPHEN R-J.
